Quick Start Guide

The purpose of this guide is to provide a visual walkthrough of using MetalAccounting.

1) Create a Company

MetalAccounting provides a sandbox to create financial statements from journal entries. The base object in this sandbox is the Company object.

From the main menu, navigate to the companies page.

From the companies page, select New Company

Enter the name for your new company, then click Save

2) Edit a Company

You are now looking at the company's menu. You can edit the company name by clicking Edit

3) Add Accounts

From the company menu, click Open next to Accounts.

From the company's account menu, click Add Default Accounts. This option is only available for companies with zero accounts.

You will see a preview of the default accounts. Click Save Accounts to add them to your company.

Alternatively, you don't need to use default accounts. From the company accounts menu, click New Account to create a custom account from scratch.

4) Edit Accounts

From the company's account list, click Open next to the account you want to edit. You can click Delete to remove an account. Accounts with associated journal entries cannot be deleted.

From the account details page, click Edit Account to make changes. Not all account properties can be edited once created.

5) Add a Period

From the company menu, click Open next to Periods. Period objects are associated with a company and represent a block of time in which their company operated.

From the period list page, click New Period

Pick a start and end date then click Save. Period start and end dates cannot overlap with other periods associated with the same company.

6) Edit a Period

From the period list, click Edit.

A period's start and end date can be modified. A period cannot be edited to overlap with another period associated with the same company. Additionally a period cannot be modified such that a journal entry associated with the period is dated outside the bounds of its host period.

7) Create Regular Journal Entries

From the period list, click Open.

This is the period detail page. You can download reports and create journal entries.

Scroll down to the general ledger section, and click New Entry

Create Entries

9) Create Closing Journal Entries

View the trial balance for the period, note the temporary accounts with balances.

Create a closing entry that will zero out all temporary accounts. Any excess in credits or debits should be dumped to retained earnings.

10) View Financial Statements

Assets = Liabilities + Equity.

The cashflow worksheet must be completed before the cash flow statement can be viewed.
